headline: Chocolate Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: These delicious chocolate chocolate chip cookies are impossible to resist thanks to the addition of cocoa powder and semisweet chocolate chips.

video.description: See how to make the chocolate loverâ€™s chocolate chip cookie.
video.name: Chocolate Chocolate Chip Cookies I

name: Chocolate Chocolate Chip Cookies

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Beat sugar, butter, eggs, and vanilla in a large bowl until light and fluffy.

Combine flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt in another bowl; stir into butter mixture until well blended. Mix in chocolate chips and walnuts. Drop spoonfuls of dough 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake in the preheated oven just until set, 8 to 10 minutes. Cool slightly on the cookie sheets before transferring to wire racks to cool completely.

review.reviewBody: Cooked for 8 minutes and they were a little dry for my taste. Good chocolate flavor, though
Unbelievably good. Soft, chewy, a tiny bit crispy on the edges, perfect chocolate richness. I wonâ€™t freely admit to how quickly my son and I devoured an entire batch.
for chocolate lovers... Yum
Made 4 dozen. Baked for 10-12 minutes, the end texture was perfect but coming out of the oven they were very soft. I modified the chocolate chips, I used Lilyâ€™s sugar free chips. Very good!
So easy and turned out perfect
Love! I added a little salt on top of each cookie before baking. You could do 1/2 of the sugar as white and 1/2 as brown but I thought it was amazing as is.
I used white chocolate chips,just for fun!

Beat the butter, sugar, and vanilla together until puffed up, light and fluffy, before adding any other ingredients. Butter room temp. This is called creaming the butter. This gives the cookies the texture of a traditional buttercream cookie.
These are excellent!! Be sure not to overbake. Have made several times.

I LOVE THIS RECIPE!! personally iâ€™m gluten free, and this recipe works great with a simple one-for-one gluten-free flour. every time i make a batch these cookies never last more than three days in my house. definitely recommend!! :)
I loved these cookies so much would make again!

They are so much better since i used tablespoon instead of a teaspoon and I didn't roll them into a ball. They were soft and very chocolately! My husband and mom loved them. I am making them for my boss for his birthday.

I too found these to be extremely soft even giving them extra baking time. They did not hold together. They were also flat as pancakes. Everyone's ovens and cookies sheets are different so I certainly can't blame the recipe. In the future I will use one that I know works for me.
Melted everywhere
Very good! I did half the chocolate chips and was still good.
Literally the best cookie ever 10/10
I didn't add cocoa powder. I thought making green cookies with brown chocolate chips would look swell. And they did! 10/10 will only stick to this recipe.
Like brownies! Awesome cookies!
I was looking for a cookie recipe to use up cocoa powder.. this was perfect. Added cranberries to half of the batch. Cooked the cookies for 12 minutes. Will make again. Thanks for sharing the recipe.
I made these GF and DF. These are hands down the best cookies we've ever had or made. So delicious! Easy to make. Huge yield and we are them all within 48 hours ðŸ¤£
These were so easy to make and they were delicious. I chopped up Andes mints to substitute the chocolate chips and they were so good!!
So good. I mean really good. This is the first cookie I've made in my new range. Perfect. I made it as is, no nuts.
Hy husband loved these!
Love the recipe. The only thing I did different is I added 2 tsp of peppermint extract to the dough and they cam out so good
these are really yummy :P
I made it gluten free with Stevia sugar and they were very nummy.

I personally didn't like this one. I really love chocolate and cookies so I'd thought this would be perfect but it doesn't taste very good and mine were undercooked and mushy even after baking over recommend time. I'm sure this recipe is good I'm just bad at baking cookies.
easy and delicious. The dough was thick enough that I didn't have to refrigerate it before baking to keep it from getting too thin as it baked.
This is an excellent cookie. I made no changes. My hubby says itâ€™s the best cookie I ever made, and I bake a lot of cookies. Will definitely make again.

5 stars for the taste. These are one of the most delicious chocolate cookies I ever had. I followed the recipe exactly, including the walnuts. I chilled in the fridge for about 30 minutes before baking, to make sure the cookies won't be flat. To my surprise, they barely changed shape, from a ball to a dome ! I let the 2nd batch stay on the kitchen counter to come to room temperature and then flattened the cookie balls little, before baking and again they barley spread ! But, they were less thick this time. And, BTW, I keep the cookie dough in the fridge and just bake a dozen at the time, for 2 to 3 days and shape the rest of the dough into balls and freeze.
These cookies were very moist and rich. Although I didn't add as many chocolate chips as was called for. Instead, I poked three to four on top of them before baking.
it made 48, but I guess there's an evaporation rate of about 12% or so. They are delicious! Â¿;

I really liked this recipe. The only thing I am going to adjust is to use slightly less flour. The cookies were chewy the first night but second day were crunchy. They were still very tasty but we just like a chewier cookie. I used 1 cup Ghirardelli semi sweet and 1 cup Ghirardelli 60%. This made them oh so rich they way my family loves it.
Delicious! I used half butter and half shortening because that's what I use in my regular chocolate chip cookie recipe. I also used one cup white sugar and 1/2 cup brown sugar.
I used 1 cup sugar and 1/2 cup brown sugar and substituted pecans for walnuts. Everyone loved them. Super moist and rich. Great with coffee or red wine
These are my favorites! I made a few changes: a half cup of raw cane sugar, 1 tsp of Madagascar bourbon vanilla, 1 cup of chopped semisweet chocolate. My nine year old said theyâ€™re bussinâ€™!
Loved these!!!!!!!! Definitely will make these again, whole family loves them!!!!

Very sweet, but I cut the recipe in half. I always add more vanilla than I should, and I added a tablespoon or so of coffee. I had to add a bit of extra flour (2-3tbsp) and they came out very soft. I suggest mixing and matching your chocolate chips. :)
I added a little canola oil. They were good though. I tried uploading a photo, but it the photo was bigger than 2mb.

Made reciepe last year using exact direction and the only complaint I got was the crumbled as being ate...so this year I omitted the using the beaters and make it using exact measurements but mixing it like a regular drop cookie reciepe. Just mix all dry ingredients in one bowl then mix softened butter (not melted), eggs, and vanilla in different bowl, and then mix the dry bowl (1/2 bowl at a time) into wet bowl. Stir in chocolate chips and then roll cookie dough (like making meatballs). Cooked at 350Â° for 16 mins ( I used air bake sheets). Cookies are nice and soft and don't crumble when eaten
Very good and quick recipe. I added ground up Hersheyâ€™s Cookies-n-Cream kisses.

This is a great base for a cocoa-powder based cookie! I used black cocoa powder, vanilla and mint extract, and vanilla paste. I swapped the sugar for allulose and the chips for sugar free lily's mint chips. Chilled the batter for an hour before baking. They are delish!
Changed the sugar(1/2 dark brown 1/2 granulated white) and added 1 TB espresso. Delicious!!
I made them dairy free by substituting Crisco baking sticks for the butter, leaving out the chocolate chips and doubling the walnuts. They were delicious, slightly chewy little cookies.

Delicious cookie, very light. Did not need to refrigerate the dough first. Used a #16 ice cream scoop, made 72 cookies. 350ÂºF 10 minutes on parchment paper, using three 15x21 inch aluminum sheet pans. Added in a tsp of orange oil to change the flavour. Probably could of used more. A nice light cookie. Has a slight brownie flavour and texture, so the addition of walnut next time will be tried.

Made recipe as written and agree they are way too sweet. Next time, would cut the sugar to 3/4 cup and would also replace some of the white sugar with brown sugar for a little bit of a nicer flavour.

Also find these cookies are much nicer if you refrigerate the dough first (at least an hour, ideally overnight).

I used half shortening, half butter, 1/4 C. brown sugar, 3/4 C. white sugar. Also added 2/3 chopped pecans. I'd like to try using all butter next time. They turned out plenty sweet but a bit soft even though I added extra baking time. Will definitely make again.
Iâ€™ve been making cookies for over 50 yrs.

The batter was very dry and thick, so I considered adding milk, but I wanted to follow the recipe exactly the first time. I regret it. These cookies are not soft (also not hard) and there are way too many chips. I've made chocolate chip cookies for decades, so I knew I should make certain changes, but I like to follow recipes initially. 

The chocolate taste is unsatisfying, so instead of doctoring this recipe, I will use a different one next time I have a hankering for chocolate chocolate chip cookies.
Sooooooo good!! I brought them to my auntâ€™s house and they were gone in an hour, maybe. Definitely were some of the best cookies I ever made!!
Amazing!!!!! Best cookies ever! Totally worth it!!!

Oh my goodness, these cookies are absolutely delicious! I think they are the best ones I've ever made. Recipe is simple and easy to make. The only things I changed was I used margarine (I was afraid of a flat cookie with butter) and used half white sugar and brown sugar. The only thing I would add is pecans next time. Definitely making these again!!

These really are great according to the truly chocolate-loving members of my family, but it really is a LOT of chocolate. Next time I might try a different kind of chips like peanut butter to add another note besides just chocolate.
Excellent cookies! I increased cocoa to 3/4 cup (I like chocolate) and used milk chocolate chips.
Absolutely delicious! I also added some peanut butter morsels.
Flat like a pancake!
Some of the best cookies I've ever made !! I prefer a rich cocoa flavour, so I added 1 cup cocoa instead. Also substituted the walnuts for white chocolate chips. Amazing!
I added a little more coco powder and they came out prfect! my new favorit kind of cookie.
My first time baking cookies and they turned out sooooooooooo goooood
Delicious recipe. Made it according to recipe. Tastes like a brownie and a cookie at the same time. Soft and chewy. Yummy! Definitely a keeper.
OMG! These cookies were awesome and so good!! I'm 11 but I made it! even teenagers can make these cookies! AWESOME!
I wanted to halve the recipe, but accidentally used 2 eggs instead of one. The cookies were phenomenal. Not too soft, but moistâ€”-almost a cross between a brownie bite and a cookie.

This is the best cookie recipe Iâ€™ve ever made. The cookies are the perfect amount of sweet, rich, chewy and crunchy. There are no alterations necessary as these cookies come out nice and thick and not flat. They also cooked very evenly. Iâ€™m seriously impressed with this recipe.
It's very good and I added a teaspoon of cinnamon and it made it even better!
I made no changes - easy-peasy and better results than most brownies for the same great chocolate load

These are fantastic cookies! I did decrease the sugar a bit (1-1/3c) and used 1 tsp vanilla + 1 tsp rum extract, and half white chocolate chips. They are soft & oh so chocolatey. Easy to make & freeze well too. Absolutely loved them!
Used rice flour to make it gluten free!!! Yummy yummy yummy!!!!!
These cookies turned out great!
My husband made these using the Hershey's Special Dark Cocoa and our favorite Ghirardelli 60% Cacao bittersweet chocolate chips. They were so delicious I had to have a second one!
Easy enough for my kids to follow along. They LOVED these. Couldn't wait for them to cool. I did 3/4 c of white sugar and 3/4 c of brown sugar.
Oh so tasty. Just the right amount of salt to go with the sweet.
These cookies taste amazing and are very soft! I did end up keeping them in the oven slightly longer--about 13 mins, but that is to be expected with different ovens.
The recipe was easy to follow and made good cookies. I did 1 tablespoon scoops at first but they were really small so then I tried 2 tbsp and it was the perfect size.
Looking for a recipe the kids could help with and something different. They were a huge success! Iâ€™ve made them a few times and they are loved by all!
My whole family loves it, definitely a favourite!
I've been making this recipe for years. Its great!

Delicious! I was worried these might be flat after reading other reviews about alterations to avoid flat cookies, but these were perfect. A little more delicate than I expected, but crunchy outside and soft inside. The only change I made before baking was to drop by level ice cream scoop rather than rounded teaspoon. I used my 2 tablespoon spring-loaded scoop for uniform size and shape and baked them for 15 minutes, which resulted in 36 large cookies. I also sprinkled powdered sugar after they cooled.

Made these many times using 60% cocoa chips and they are always a hit! However, each time I tweaked the recipe to accomodate items in my refrigerator or cupboard, I've been disappointed. The recipe is perfect exactly as written!
These were awesome! I did 9 minutes in the oven and they came out perfect.

These cookies came out AMAZING. Next day and they are still soft and gooey and very chocolatey! I used m&ms and dark chocolate chips. Next time I will try just the dark chocolate chips or maybe even macadamia nuts. One thing I would like to also try is doing half regular sugar and half brown sugar to see if that makes a difference. The original recipe itself is 5 stars and Iâ€™m glad I made it!
Best cookies EVER! Melted chocolate in the middle, cocoa powder adds a deep chocolate richness that's the perfect amount of sweetness!
Sooo good that I made an account to post a review! I used white chocolate chips instead of normal ones and they were delicious. 10/10 would recommend
Made a batch of 24 didn't turn out very nice, definitely needs a lot more sugar otherwise pretty ok recipe
We make a ton of cookies around here and these are among the best. They are perfectly chocolatey and remain chewy. I follow the recipe to the tee and itâ€™s perfect just as it is.
I made these cookies with dark chocolate cocoa powder and they came out great! Taste like the Pizza Hut brownies!! I will try dark chocolate chips next time.
This is a fantastic recipe! I made mine just as written with one change, I used canna butter and wow the chocolate really masks the distinct canna butter flavour. Enjoy everyone

These were amazing!! They are almost like a brownie and a cookie got married and had babies!!! Sooooo good!! I did follow some suggestions like using half/half brown sugar/white sugar, and chilling the dough for one hour before baking. They turned out incredible! One thing though, they didn't expand, they turned out chunky. Next time I will flatten them a bit before baking. This recipe is def a keeper in my book!!!
My cookies didnâ€™t spread....they taste delicious, but the are the same balls I put in. Lol is it because I used Splenda and not granulated sugar?....
Best chocolate chocolate chip cookies ever!
Soft,chewy chocolate cookies!! This recipe is a keeper
These turned out superb! Loved them!
My family loved these! I would recommend this recipe
Family loved it!!! Tastes like crusty chewy brownies!
Recipe was pretty good. Turned out great. The only thing I would do next time is reduce the amount of sugar.

went with half white and brown sugar. also used dark and semisweet chips. totally
delightful!
Made as directed. Great chocolate cookie!
I used a lot of chocolate chips & used Stevia instead of white sugar..turned out delicious

I loved the taste of this cookie! Out of all of the cookies I've had, I think this is my favorite. Actually, my grandma's chocolate cookie recipe is forever my #1 favorite. So this would be my second favorite. Thank you so much for posting this on here whoever invented these!
